summary: Audioslave was an American rock band formed in 2001, blending 1970s hard rock and 1990s alternative rock. The group consisted of Chris Cornell (Soundgarden) and members of Rage Against the Machine. They released three albums, received three Grammy nominations, and sold over eight million records worldwide. Audioslave disbanded in 2007 when Cornell left, but they reunited briefly in 2017 before Cornell's death later that year.
title: Audioslave
